body.name: Wings of Destiny: A USS Enterprise Naval Adventure Novel (Fightin'est Ship in WWII series Book 1)
body.description: A storm lurks over the horizon… a storm that will change the world forever.On December 7, 1941, the United States was thrust into the largest global conflict of all time. From adversity rose a generation of heroes both at home and abroad whose courage, valor and sacrifice would restore a world gone mad! Yet not all of WWII’s heroes were flesh and blood… they were also made of steel and forged in the fire of combat.The USS Enterprise CV-6, was the most decorated ship of WWII. She earned 20 battle stars and delivered devastating punch after devastating punch to the Empire of Japan… and took more than her share of them, too. This series celebrates the mighty carrier and the men who served her. Join them on this epic journey across the Pacific and through time – you’ll come aboard and sit in the cockpit and sore across the skies in this action-packed historical adventure!In Wings of Destiny, you join a group of pilots and sailors readying for war. The clock is ticking and Yamamoto’s massive fleet rushes for Pearl Harbor. Wing into the skies over Hawaii and straight into the most devastating air attack of all time and live the gut-wrenching experiences of some of the war’s most famous fighting men.Guns blaze, cannons roar and the skies come alive with warbirds in this first carrier thriller! Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #12,755 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #57 in War Fiction (Kindle Store) #59 in War & Military Action Fiction (Kindle Store) #86 in Historical World War II Fiction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Non stop action with a story line that is very engaging. Quite difficult to put down, ready for the next installment!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice Start of War Book
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy war friction based on history this book fills the bill. I would like for it to be longer but it follows today's trend of short books followed by sequels. Authors like George Wallace or Leo Tolstoy would be appalled by this trend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Learned a lot of things I didn’t know very well told and gave some insight as to what was happening on the carriers that weren’t in Pearl. Very few stories told about that situation. Didn’t know about the first job. Vote being sunk either. Great book but too short.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fast paced and filled with action. Introduces a cast of characters, both historical and fictional. I'm looking forward to reading the other volumes in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well written, fast pacedl
reviews.reviewText: Like his sniper and Bull Shark series this book is well written and over before you know it. My father was on the USS California which was the only battleship sunk raised and refitted to see battle later in the war. I toured Pearl Harbour a few years ago and even after 80+ years it is still an emotional rollercoster. I have his cruise books (like a yearbook for the ship) and standing on that ground and reading the accounts makes me proud of my father and the thousands like him that fought and sometimes died for our freedom

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Wham bam and Done
reviews.reviewText: Excellent writing for the first couple of chapters of a historical novel about the Enterprise. I will not be caught again not checking the length of a book I buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Loved the 1st person view. Wish it was longer as I know there are so many untold stories out there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Another good read!
reviews.reviewText: Scott has an entertaining way of telling a story. You become involved like you were there.Even though the tale of Pearl Harbor has been told many times, this is a new outlook.I enjoyed it and am already heading to book #2.
